definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: He started squandering and squandered with such spirit, that all his worldly wealth was I. O. U.
sentences.chinese: 他開始大肆揮霍，直到所有的財富都成了欠條。

sentences.english: Adding in black-market lending and the increasing use of IOUs to settle payments takes the total even higher.
sentences.chinese: 加上黑市貸款和越來越多地使用欠條，總數會更高。

sentences.english: It wasn't quite the paper money that we know， it was more like a piece of paper saying a promise to pay.
sentences.chinese: 這種紙幣與我們現在使用的不同，更象是一種欠條。

sentences.english: But three of them all forgot what had happened about the credit two years ago.
sentences.chinese: 但三人都記不起兩年前關於這張欠條發生了什麼。

definition: lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
it's the most capable people who do the most work (idiom) (intended as consolation for the overworked, or flattery when making a request etc)
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
a friend in times of tribulations (idiom); a friend in need is a friend indeed
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
